statement: Coca-Cola, the world's top plastic polluter for the sixth-consecutive year, has scaled back its environmental promises. The company has removed targets to reduce virgin plastic use by 3 million metric tons by 2025 and has instead set a vague goal to "aim to reduce the company's Scope 1 emissions." Coca-Cola's new environmental goals include increasing the use of reusable packaging and aiming to have at least 25% of its beverages sold in refillable containers by volume. The company has also joined the U.S. Plastics Pact and the Ellen MacArthur Foundation's global commitment to reduce plastic waste.
introduction: Coca-Cola has scaled back its environmental promises, removing targets to reduce virgin plastic use and instead setting vague goals to "aim to reduce Scope 1 emissions" and increase reusable packaging.
